newsitem.title: UK: Japanese stocks in London down, but Sony shines.
newsitem.headline: Japanese stocks in London down, but Sony shines.

text.p: Japanese shares were generally lower in quite European trade with the exception of Sony Corp, which continued to attract buyers after reporting record profits in Tokyo on Thursday.
"We're seeing a little bit of profit-taking in London today. But volumes are pretty low since most of Europe is away today," one dealer said.
Although London markets are open, most major European bourses, including those in Germany, France, Switzerland and the Netherlands are closed due to the Ascension Day holiday.
Sony, which earlier announced full-year profits of 139.46 billion yen($1.12 billion), up 2.6-fold from the previous year, was trading at 9,847.5 yen versus a Tokyo close of 9,720 yen.
The electronic giant's shares touched 9.870 yen in London and some market participants think they could reach the 10,000 yen level in the near-term.
Elsewhere, Toyota was trading at 3,900 yen versus a Tokyo close of 3,940 yen by 1400 GMT.
